aber.dcs.clg11.wordladder.model

Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • aber.dcs.clg11.wordladder.model.Graph

  • public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
    Main data class within the application used to represent the Graph data structure. Contains both search algorithms (BFS and DLS) and the adjacency list implementation via a hash table.
    Author:
    Connor Goddard (clg11)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Graph()
      Default constructor for Graph.
      Graph(java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> input)
      Instantiates a new Graph, with the ability to generate the graph using a Vector of strings.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean breadthFirstSearch(java.lang.String word, java.lang.String target)
      Breadth first search algorithm that traverses from the specified root node through every level of the Graph until it locates the specified target node.
      boolean checkWords(java.lang.String word1, java.lang.String word2)
      Compares two strings to identify if they are one letter apart.
      void createGraph(java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> input)
      Populates the adjacency list structure using data obtained via the ReadFile class.
      boolean depthSearch(java.lang.String word, int currentDepth, int maxDepth)
      Depth limited search that traverses through the graph from a specified root node to create a word ladder of specified length.
      int getGraphSize()
      Retrieves the total size of the graph by counting all the elements (Nodes) contained within the hash table.
      Node getNode(java.lang.String searchTerm)
      Returns the Node object that represents the search term entered by the user.
      OutputStack getOutputStack()
      Retrieves the OutputStack object used to store the result path of either search algorithm
      void resetSearch()
      Resets search variables contained within every Node object currently within the Graph.

      • createGraph

        public void createGraph(java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> input)
        Populates the adjacency list structure using data obtained via the ReadFile class.
        Parameters:
        input - Vector containing data to populate the graph

      • checkWords

        public boolean checkWords(java.lang.String word1,
                 java.lang.String word2)
        Compares two strings to identify if they are one letter apart.
        Parameters:
        word1 - The first word to compare
        word2 - The second word to compare
        Returns:
        true If the two words are one letter apart

      • depthSearch

        public boolean depthSearch(java.lang.String word,
                  int currentDepth,
                  int maxDepth)
        Depth limited search that traverses through the graph from a specified root node to create a word ladder of specified length.
        Parameters:
        word - The specified root node (also used as part of the recursive function).
        currentDepth - The current depth of the search within the graph (used as part of the recursive function)
        maxDepth - The maximum depth that the search can traverse to (i.e. the specified word ladder length)
        Returns:
        true Returns if path is able to be retrieved.

      • getNode

        public Node getNode(java.lang.String searchTerm)
        Returns the Node object that represents the search term entered by the user.
        Parameters:
        searchTerm - The word that is to be returned.
        Returns:
        The node object that represents the specified word.

      • resetSearch

        public void resetSearch()
        Resets search variables contained within every Node object currently within the Graph.

      • breadthFirstSearch

        public boolean breadthFirstSearch(java.lang.String word,
                         java.lang.String target)
        Breadth first search algorithm that traverses from the specified root node through every level of the Graph until it locates the specified target node. The algorithm then returns the shortest possible path (i.e. word ladder) between the root and target nodes. Code modified from original source code available at: http://www.codeproject.com/script/Articles/ViewDownloads.aspx?aid=32212
        Parameters:
        word - The specified root node.
        target - The specified target node.
        Returns:
        true Returns if a path is able to be retrieved.

      • getOutputStack

        public OutputStack getOutputStack()
        Retrieves the OutputStack object used to store the result path of either search algorithm
        Returns:
        the output stack containing the word ladder path generated by the search algorithms.

      • getGraphSize

        public int getGraphSize()
        Retrieves the total size of the graph by counting all the elements (Nodes) contained within the hash table.
        Returns:
        the number of elements within the hash table (adjacency list).
